_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary

Duck River Utility Commission     Tullahoma, Tennessee

The Duck River Utility Commission operates a potable water filtration plant and related facilities on TVA's Normandy Reservoir near Tullahoma, Tennessee.  The DRUC is committed to providing pure and plentiful potable water to the Manchester and Tullahoma communities as well as protecting the safety of its employees, the community and the environment.  The Commission takes great pride in observing standard industrial safety precautions in preventing hazards in the workplace, and implementing fail-safe contingency plans in the unlikely event of a mishap.  This two-pronged approach includes the following:

1.  The latest technology in process controls, monitoring and detection systems. 

2.  Active and passive mitigation systems designed to eliminate and/or defuse the impact of leakage, fire, or explosion and other hazards.

The DRUC stores and utilizes one-ton cylinders of liquefied chlorine gas for the disinfection processes at the water treatment plant.  There are normally four to six full and two to four empty cylinders stored at the facility inside a secure brick and block building.  These containers of liquefied chlorine are regulated under the USEPA's Risk Management Plan program.

The DRUC has an excellent accident and chemical release prevention program.  The reportable spill or release history of the Commission includes zero spillage, zero deaths, and zero worker injuries.  The DRUC has implemented stringent loading, operation and maintenance procedures to prevent the accidental release of chlorine gas.

The DRUC Emergency Response Program has been evaluated to produce the maximum impact in the least amount of time.  The DRUC has coordinated with all local governments and fire departments to provide effective communications and rapid response in an emergency situation.  The DRUC staff will respond immediately to a release event by taking the following basic actions: 

1.Remotely engage

active mitigation system (chlorine gas scrubber system) if not automatically started.

2.Dial 911.  Notify the Coffee County Emergency Management Agency.

3.Contact the fire department hazard response team and verify notification by 911 operator.

4.Evacuate the DRUC facilities and the appropriate perimeter area using evacuation plan maps.

Planned changes as a result of our last safety review include: 

  None at this time.

Questions about this program or the chemical storage at the DRUC facilities may be directed to Randal J. Braker, General Manager at (931) 455-6458.
